column4: can someone help me? i spent hours organizing my contacts in pidgin the way i wanted them, but it keeps forgetting them and i have to redo everything over and over again.. how do i make it stay?
it may be a bug
thanks
what exactly happens in pidgin

well it defaulty has like 15 groups.. and i only want 2... so i dragged them all into the appropriate groups .... then when i restart it... it ungroups them where i had them and readds the old deleted groups
mine did that once and i moved them again and it hasnt messed up lately
if your googling you can also just post the link here
well i'm finding forum posts so instead of having him or her read thru the whole thing i was just gunna post the command
yes thats a really nice thing to do
but instead of rushing from page to page to get info may not be the best route for others sometimes they need to read it themselfes
okee dokee
i didnt mean to be a jerk but i like to enforce the lurk more method because learning how things work rather than just commands is a lot more helpful in the long run
explain further??
a lot of times on forums people give good hints as to why certain commands act the way tey do and learning about a certain distro and its install methods will help in the future if problems arise
as in knowing how apt-get works and where the downloads come from
allrighty!  yah i've only sorta figured those out
but i forget everytime i go to put in a new repository.. and have to look it up again.. one day i will memorize it LOL
its a nice look congrats
thanks it took me FOREVER to find the icons i wanted but i'm really happy with it... i can't fully do it up the way i want unless i learn to make them myself.. but i'm happy with my current result
you can make your own icons using "the gimp"
i like my icons.. but i wanna make the mouse pointers.. but me and gimp will be about as effective as me with a paper and pencil... 4 yr old adhd child on crack with a broken crayon
